greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to partition the Young diagram of the integer partition with Heinz number n into vertical sections of the same sizes as the parts of the original partition.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1, ..., y_k) is prime(y_1) * ... * prime(y_k).
A vertical section is a partial Young diagram with at most one square in each row. For example, a suitable partition (shown as a coloring by positive integers) of the Young diagram of (322) is:
example: The a(30) = 12 partitions of the Young diagram of (321) into vertical sections of sizes (321), shown as colorings by positive integers:
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Nov 18 2018
